This looks good to me. 2 comments:
1. The case of `fully` region should also be covered. You can see in line 44 that it's the same logic as the `else` when `isScrollable` is `null`.
2. The test IMO should be just like other screenshoter tests, where before taking the screenshot you would scroll the page. I would cover both default *and* custom `scrollingElement`.

pull_request.title: Add the scroll offset to region
pull_request.body:
## Add to the region offset the scroll offset.

The calculation of the region base of the [`getBoundingClientRect`](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/blob/07d0fb36b5ce7ecb88c3d4854871686d082b664c/js/packages/snippets/src/browser/getElementRect.js#L13), the `getBoundingClientRect` calculate the offset ["relative to the viewport"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect).

This is a problem if the test scrolls the page before before `eyes.check` because it's trying to move to the `region` while `"SER"` is already scrolled

This fix the issue by adding to the `x` and `y` coordinates of the `region` the
scroll `x` and `y` coordinates.

this will also solve [1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot](https://trello.com/c/610tyGMr/1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot) ticket

## Testing

TBD;

pull_request.title: Cypress setup fix
pull_request.body:
> Following [this PR](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/pull/1020) of supporting a 'caret' in Cypress version

* 'Cypress' version in 'npx eyes-setup' script should be verified against the actual installed 'Cypress' version, aka: `node_modules/cypress/package.json -> version` (and not as it was: against the 'project' `package.json -> version`)
* The **test** for 'npx eyes-setup' script was moved from 'it' to 'e2e' since 'Cypress' installation is required.
* The logic of parsing and validating the version by using `semver` in `/bin/eyes-setup.js` remained the same as before (although in current implementation, version should never have a caret) .
* No change-log since the initial fix functionality ([this PR](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/pull/1020)) was **not** released yet and this branch only improves that functionality, original change-log record is: _Fix `npx eyes-setup` for Cypress version with a caret, support `e2e.ts` as support file_
* Tests are failing, this is being handled in a different Branch

issue.title: `eyes-storybook`: Improved `start-storybook` command path resolution algorithm
issue.body:
# Changes
Improved `start-storybook` command path resolution algorithm, using an implementation of npm's resolution algorithm.
Fixes a problem where `eyes-storybook` crashed on load when npm workspaces is used.

Given the following file tree:
```txt
root/
  |-- package.json
  |-- node_modules/
    |-- .bin/
      |-- start-storybook
  |-- subProject/
    |-- package.json
    |-- node_modules/
      |-- .bin/
```

When running `eyes-storybook` inside of `root/subProject`:
* The current implementation will check if `root/subProject/node_modules/.bin/start-storybook` exists and will then fail if it doesn't
* The new implementation will search the file tree for a `./node_modules/.bin/start-storybook` file like npm's own implementation, and in this example it will find and use `root/node_modules/.bin/start-storybook`

pull_request.title: Add the scroll offset to region
pull_request.body:
## Add to the region offset the scroll offset.

The calculation of the region base of the [`getBoundingClientRect`](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/blob/07d0fb36b5ce7ecb88c3d4854871686d082b664c/js/packages/snippets/src/browser/getElementRect.js#L13), the `getBoundingClientRect` calculate the offset ["relative to the viewport"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect).

This is a problem if the test scrolls the page before before `eyes.check` because it's trying to move to the `region` while `"SER"` is already scrolled

This fix the issue by adding to the `x` and `y` coordinates of the `region` the
scroll `x` and `y` coordinates.

this will also solve [1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot](https://trello.com/c/610tyGMr/1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot) ticket

## Testing

TBD;

pull_request.title: Cypress setup fix
pull_request.body:
> Following [this PR](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/pull/1020) of supporting a 'caret' in Cypress version

* 'Cypress' version in 'npx eyes-setup' script should be verified against the actual installed 'Cypress' version, aka: `node_modules/cypress/package.json -> version` (and not as it was: against the 'project' `package.json -> version`)
* The **test** for 'npx eyes-setup' script was moved from 'it' to 'e2e' since 'Cypress' installation is required.
* The logic of parsing and validating the version by using `semver` in `/bin/eyes-setup.js` remained the same as before (although in current implementation, version should never have a caret) .
* No change-log since the initial fix functionality ([this PR](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/pull/1020)) was **not** released yet and this branch only improves that functionality, original change-log record is: _Fix `npx eyes-setup` for Cypress version with a caret, support `e2e.ts` as support file_
* Tests are failing, this is being handled in a different Branch

issue.title: `eyes-storybook`: Improved `start-storybook` command path resolution algorithm
issue.body:
# Changes
Improved `start-storybook` command path resolution algorithm, using an implementation of npm's resolution algorithm.
Fixes a problem where `eyes-storybook` crashed on load when npm workspaces is used.

Given the following file tree:
```txt
root/
  |-- package.json
  |-- node_modules/
    |-- .bin/
      |-- start-storybook
  |-- subProject/
    |-- package.json
    |-- node_modules/
      |-- .bin/
```

When running `eyes-storybook` inside of `root/subProject`:
* The current implementation will check if `root/subProject/node_modules/.bin/start-storybook` exists and will then fail if it doesn't
* The new implementation will search the file tree for a `./node_modules/.bin/start-storybook` file like npm's own implementation, and in this example it will find and use `root/node_modules/.bin/start-storybook`

pull_request.title: Add the scroll offset to region
pull_request.body:
## Add to the region offset the scroll offset.

The calculation of the region base of the [`getBoundingClientRect`](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/blob/07d0fb36b5ce7ecb88c3d4854871686d082b664c/js/packages/snippets/src/browser/getElementRect.js#L13), the `getBoundingClientRect` calculate the offset ["relative to the viewport"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect).

This is a problem if the test scrolls the page before before `eyes.check` because it's trying to move to the `region` while `"SER"` is already scrolled

This fix the issue by adding to the `x` and `y` coordinates of the `region` the
scroll `x` and `y` coordinates.

this will also solve [1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot](https://trello.com/c/610tyGMr/1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot) ticket

## Testing

TBD;

pull_request.title: Cypress setup fix
pull_request.body:
> Following [this PR](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/pull/1020) of supporting a 'caret' in Cypress version

* 'Cypress' version in 'npx eyes-setup' script should be verified against the actual installed 'Cypress' version, aka: `node_modules/cypress/package.json -> version` (and not as it was: against the 'project' `package.json -> version`)
* The **test** for 'npx eyes-setup' script was moved from 'it' to 'e2e' since 'Cypress' installation is required.
* The logic of parsing and validating the version by using `semver` in `/bin/eyes-setup.js` remained the same as before (although in current implementation, version should never have a caret) .
* No change-log since the initial fix functionality ([this PR](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/pull/1020)) was **not** released yet and this branch only improves that functionality, original change-log record is: _Fix `npx eyes-setup` for Cypress version with a caret, support `e2e.ts` as support file_
* Tests are failing, this is being handled in a different Branch

issue.title: `eyes-storybook`: Improved `start-storybook` command path resolution algorithm
issue.body:
# Changes
Improved `start-storybook` command path resolution algorithm, using an implementation of npm's resolution algorithm.
Fixes a problem where `eyes-storybook` crashed on load when npm workspaces is used.

Given the following file tree:
```txt
root/
  |-- package.json
  |-- node_modules/
    |-- .bin/
      |-- start-storybook
  |-- subProject/
    |-- package.json
    |-- node_modules/
      |-- .bin/
```

When running `eyes-storybook` inside of `root/subProject`:
* The current implementation will check if `root/subProject/node_modules/.bin/start-storybook` exists and will then fail if it doesn't
* The new implementation will search the file tree for a `./node_modules/.bin/start-storybook` file like npm's own implementation, and in this example it will find and use `root/node_modules/.bin/start-storybook`
